meanings.definition: To carry out or perform again
meanings.sent1: She decided to reexecute the experiment to ensure accurate results.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to reexecute their math problems for practice.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to reexecute the recipe after realizing he forgot an ingredient.
meanings.sent4: The artist reexecuted the painting to capture the true essence of the landscape.
meanings.sent5: Reexecuting the dance routine helped the team perfect their performance.

meanings.definition: To repeat the execution of a task or program
meanings.sent1: The computer program kept reexecuting the same command, causing errors.
meanings.sent2: The technician had to reexecute the software installation to fix the bug.
meanings.sent3: The robot kept reexecuting the same function, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The clock seemed to be reexecuting time itself, stuck in a loop.
meanings.sent5: Reexecuting the code allowed the programmer to identify the mistake easily.
